title: Sounds
description: The sounds.json file defines sound events, entity sounds, block sounds, and interactive sounds for a resource pack. This is the legacy sound configuration file; for newer projects, consider using sound_definitions.json instead.

fields.title: Individual Event Sounds
fields.description: Defines individual sound events that can be triggered by various game actions.

fields.title: Events
fields.description: A collection of event sound definitions keyed by event name.

subForm.title: Event Sound
subForm.description: Defines a sound for a specific event.

fields.title: Sound
fields.description: The sound identifier to play for this event.

fields.title: Volume
fields.description: Volume multiplier for this sound. Can be a single value or a range [min, max].

fields.title: Pitch
fields.description: Pitch multiplier for this sound. Can be a single value or a range [min, max].

fields.title: Block Sounds
fields.description: Defines sounds that play when interacting with blocks (breaking, placing, stepping).

fields.title: Entity Sounds
fields.description: Defines sounds for entities, including defaults and entity-specific overrides.

fields.title: Defaults
fields.description: Default sound settings that apply to all entities unless overridden.

fields.title: Volume
fields.description: Default volume for entity sounds.

fields.title: Pitch
fields.description: Default pitch for entity sounds.

fields.title: Events
fields.description: Default sounds for various entity events.

fields.title: Sound
fields.description: The sound to play for this event.

fields.title: Volume
fields.description: Volume for this event sound.

fields.title: Pitch
fields.description: Pitch for this event sound.

fields.title: Entities
fields.description: Entity-specific sound configurations that override defaults.

subForm.title: Entity Sound Configuration
subForm.description: Sound configuration for a specific entity type.

fields.title: Volume
fields.description: Volume multiplier for this entity's sounds.

fields.title: Pitch
fields.description: Pitch multiplier for this entity's sounds. Can be a single value or a range [min, max].

fields.title: Events
fields.description: Sound events for this entity, which can have material-based variations.

fields.title: Sound
fields.description: The sound to play for this event.

fields.title: Default
fields.description: The default sound to play if no material-specific sound matches.

fields.title: Wood
fields.description: Sound to play when on wood material.

fields.title: Gravel
fields.description: Sound to play when on gravel material.

fields.title: Grass
fields.description: Sound to play when on grass material.

fields.title: Stone
fields.description: Sound to play when on stone material.

fields.title: Snow
fields.description: Sound to play when on snow material.

fields.title: Sand
fields.description: Sound to play when on sand material.

fields.title: Interactive Sounds
fields.description: Defines sounds for interactive elements like UI and special blocks.

fields.title: Block Sounds
fields.description: Sounds for interactive block types.

fields.title: Volume
fields.description: Volume for this block's sounds.

fields.title: Pitch
fields.description: Pitch for this block's sounds.

fields.title: Events
fields.description: Sound events for this interactive block.

fields.description: The sound identifier to play.

fields.title: Volume
fields.description: Volume for this event.

fields.title: Pitch
fields.description: Pitch for this event.

fields.title: Entity Sounds
fields.description: Sounds for interactive entity types.

fields.title: Individual Named Sounds
fields.description: Defines named sounds that can be referenced directly.

fields.title: Sounds
fields.description: A collection of named sound definitions.

fields.title: Sound
fields.description: The sound identifier.

fields.title: Volume
fields.description: Volume for this sound.

fields.title: Pitch
fields.description: Pitch for this sound.

note: The sounds.json file is a comprehensive sound configuration file that has been used since early versions of Bedrock Edition. For newer sound definitions with format versioning, consider using sound_definitions.json instead.
